title.narrative: Addressing special needs for sexual and reproductive health and gender-based violence for women, girls, the elderly and people with disabilities in flood affected areas

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving assistance to the most vulnerable and disadvantaged populations, including girls, the elderly, and people with disabilities (PWDs), by meeting their special needs for sexual and reproductive health (SRH) and gender-based violence (GBV) in eight flood-affected provinces and Da Nang city of Vietnam. This $799,889 UNFPA project provides SRH services especially in the area of maternal health, distributes dignity kits, disseminates information on SRH and GBV via text message and provides tele- and mobile care services for the elderly. The project provides life-saving assistance to 50,800 people, including 43,000 women, 8000 men, 7,000 girls and 1,500 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Addressing special needs for sexual and reproductive health and gender-based violence for women, girls, the elderly and people with disabilities in flood affected areas
Disbursement to CERF Project Addressing special needs for sexual and reproductive health and gender-based violence for women, girls, the elderly and people with disabilities in flood affected areas

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS VIET NAM RAPID RESPONSE FLOOD 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: GBV prevention and response by providing information and services through distribution of dignity kits, dissemination of GBV/SRH short text messages, and through mobile apps for the elderly “S-Health”.
Number of dignity kits distributed to women and girls, the elderly and PWDs with disabilities at risk of GBV/DV.
Number of elderly who have accessed SRH and GBV information and services from the mobile apps “S-Health” developed by Explus.
Number of people who have received GBV/SRH information via mobile phone text messages.
Outreach/mobile services of quality SRH (esp. maternal health) and health sector response to GBV provided in 8 floods affected provinces and 1 city.
Number of girls under age 18 receiving clinical SRH services, life-saving protection information and health sector response to GBV through outreach and mobile SRH/GBV teams.

Number of women and girls supported with transportation costs to utilise outreach/mobile SRH services (as several of the affected areas are very remote, it is important to provide women and girls with small cash amounts to enable them to travel to the locations of outreach/mobile teams)
Number of women over 18 receiving SRH services, life-saving protection information and health sector response to GBV through outreach and mobile SRH/GBV teams.
